intro: Ligia cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician ligia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and produces small, greenish flowers in summer. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Ligia cilicica is often found in scrublands and along coastal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
